string.text: You are affected by PTSD from watching your closest friend and former travelling companion get torn to shreds by a Whirligig Anomaly.
You have grown fond of cooking and eating mutant meat during your time in the Zone, and know plenty of recipes for preparing mutants.
You have come to the Zone to escape crippling gambling debt, and you're desperate to make enough money here to pay it off.
You are obsessed with pushing further north, and want to one day explore the Chernobyl Reactor.

You are starting to regret your affiliation with the Renegades. After having done and experienced horrible things in the Zone you have recently turned to Christianity and Jesus in a last ditch attempt to repent and save your soul.
You are long divorced and came to the Zone to forget about your ex-wife, who left you but whom you still can't get over.
You regret coming to the Zone and long to escape back out to the normal world.

You found an old worn copy of 'The Way of Zen' by Alan Watts. In a desperate attempt to cope with the stress of the Zone you have turned to it, hoping Zen Buddhism might give you some sort of peace. You don't have any deeper understanding but you tell yourself muttering random quotes from the book helps somehow.
You are a guilt-ridden former career criminal and assassin who is hiding out in the Zone.
You are a habitual gambling addict. You try to engage people you meet in the Zone in casual wagers whenever the opportunity arises.

Before coming to the Zone you racked up the debts together with your brother in a failed business venture selling socks online. The night after you declared bankruptcy your brother stole your passport and left the country, leaving you with the debts. With nowhere to run from the loan sharks' collectors you fled into the Zone.
You came here because of owing back rent and a broken lease. You figured collectors wouldn't follow you into the Zone.
You came to the Zone because your girlfriend aborted your baby. You wanted to keep it and start a family, and the conflict ruined your relationship. You came here running from the silence.
You kept your habit from the outside world of writing figures in a small black leatherbound accounts book: artifacts sold, bullets spent, cigarettes borrowed, people killed.
You used to be a graveyard night guard before coming to the Zone.
You came to the Zone because a judge offered probation if you stayed out of town. You figured nobody would keep track of you here.
You used to be a village electrician. You're always on the lookout for scrap electronics you might be able to fix up and sell.
You used to be a night taxi driver who knew every pothole. Here you map anomalies by the same memory trick.
Your family on the outside thinks you're working on an oil rig. You are always on the lookout for photos and mementos to send them that can keep up the lie.
You used to sell seeds at a market in Kiev. You still use seed envelopes to sort and store spare bullets.

You used to be a locksmith a long time ago. You turned your skill into a lucrative career of breaking-and-entering - at least until you got arrested. You came to the Zone to avoid serving a lengthy prison sentence.
You are secretly a psychopath, and you saw the Zone as the perfect opportunity to live out your sadistic tendencies without anyone noticing.
You keep a cracked snowglobe of your hometown in an inside pocket. You take it out and shake it whenever the homesickness becomes too great.
You came to the Zone hoping to make enough money to pay your mother back for a loan on an engine. She died alone from pneumonia while you where in here, before the loan was repaid.
You came to the Zone after your wife took the kids and left saying "choose either us or the bottle". You chose the Zone instead.
You have a habit of keeping several different-colored plastic bags on you and you use them to sort your inventory into categories. The green bag is reserved for 'the good stuff'.
You have a daughter on the outside who sometimes sends you postcards and letters. It's the only thing that still keeps you going.
You used to be an office worker, but came to the Zone after a doctor found black spots on your lungs. You wanted your last years to be more exciting.

You keep a lucky coin with you at all times: an american silver dollar from 1881. You have always struggled to make decisions, so whenever a choice seems too hard you flip your lucky coin to help you decide.

You carry a cracked and broken Zippo lighter engraved with a monogram - your only memento of your childhood sweetheart who died in a car accident. You still reach for it out of habit whenever you light a cigarette, despite years having passed since it broke.
You used to be a concrete tester in your former life. You have a habit of tapping walls to see if they are solidly constructed in case you need to take shelter from an emission.
You came to the Zone with your brother-in-law after he promised a fortune in artifacts. The brother-in-law died to a pack of blind dogs in the first week.
You used to be the night cashier at a 24h store. Your sleep schedule hasn't reset even after all these years and you have trouble sleeping at night.
You have taken up origami in an attempt to stay sane in the Zone. You like folding empty cigarette packs into paper cranes and leaving them in unexpected places.

You were a grave digger in your previous life. That is, until you were caught digging up freshly dug graves and stealing valuable items the dead were interred with. Luckily nobody bats an eye if you steal from the dead in the Zone.
You came to the Zone after you proposed to your girlfriend and she laughed at you, saying she needs stability and not a man who smells like diesel and regret. You intend to prove your worth to her.
You have a sister in Canada who sends you money to help you in your life in the Zone. You constantly struggle with the pressure of not letting her down.
You came to the Zone because you got caught selling expensive cars stolen from the rich people in Rublyovka. You escaped on bail and figured the bounty hunters wouldn't follow you here.

You were brought up by your mother to keep meticulous track of your income and expenses after your father got jailed for twenty years over fraud and tax evasion charges when you were eight years old. You still keep receipts of everything you buy and sell, despite there being no taxes or authority in the Zone.
You used to be a cinema projectionist in your previous life. You have a vast knowledge of movies and film trivia and enjoy talking about it - particularly the classics.

You were a complete failure in your previous life, a college dropout who couldn't hold on to a job. One day you snuck into the Zone unannounced to forge a new life. Everyone who knew you on the outside thinks you're dead - and perhaps it's better that way.

You were the victim of a drunk driver in your life before the Zone. The doctors saved your life, but you were uninsured and the hospital bills put you in crippling debt. You saw the Zone was your only way out - either you die here or you make enough money to pay off your debts.

You keep a folded and worn photo of your ex-girlfriend's dog in an inside pocket. The ex-girlfriend was a cold-hearted bitch you're glad to see the back of, but her dog was the most endearing creature you've ever come across.

You came to the Zone with your two good friends. You've had to bury both at this point, and their ghosts still haunt you. You try to visit their graves on their birthdays, when you'll pour a drink on their grave and chainsmoke cigarettes all night recapping your past year.

Before coming to the Zone you were a petty thief together with your brother, but he took the fall for the copper wire you both stole several years ago and you haven't seen him since. You send letters to him in prison along with half your artifact money, but he never writes back.
In your previous life you used to smuggle bootleg cigarettes across the Dnieper. One night one of your contacts tipped you off that the real money to be made was smuggling artifacts out of the Zone.
You used to be a slaughterhouse worker in your previous life. Blood and smell don't bother you and hunting and butchering mutants comes naturally.
You have developed a slight limp in your right leg after a close encounter with a pseudodog. You're still not used to the constant dull pain.
You were sacked by the railway for drinking on the job. Maybe coming here was a mistake and an overreaction, but at least there are no supervisors in the Zone.

Your ex-wife left with your daughter, who you haven't seen since she was eight. You send half your earnings to her in envelopes, hoping she follows your instructions in the enclosed letters to put the money away for an education and make better life decisions than you.

You've been in the Zone for several years. You can't remember the last time someone adressed you by your full given name, and your memories of the normal world are becoming hazy. You sometimes worry that you're losing touch with your old self and will never be able to go back to the normal world.
You used to make money as a self-employed taxi driver in your previous life. After having to sell your cab to pay the divorce lawyers you had no way to keep working, so you came to the Zone.

You have become obsessed with the myth of the Oasis, and you are determined to be the next person in the Zone to find it. You carry complex, nonsensical maps you have drawn that you claim will lead to it.
You are addicted to betting on fights in the arena in Rostok.
You are scared of being out at night in the Zone after a close encounter with a Poltergeist almost cost you your life.

Your brother went into the Zone seven years ago promising he'd return a rich man. You haven't heard from him since, and now your mother has gotten terminal cancer. You decided to come find him and bring him back in time to say final goodbyes.
You grew up dirt poor, and couldn't afford a higher education. The promise of the Zone seemed like your best bet to strike it rich.

You have discovered several mutated fungi species in the Zone that have psychedelic properties. You are worryingly frequently high on tea brewed on these fungi, although if confronted you would never admit that you are addicted.

You are addicted to morphine. It started as a medical necessity after sustaining a minor combat injury in the Zone, but it quickly became your only comfort to deal with the mental stress of life in the Zone.

When you were still fairly fresh in the Zone you foolhardily tried to venture into the Red Forest. You were left gravely injured after stepping into an anomaly and would have died were it not for a random Freedom patrol passing by. Since then you've been extremely wary of pushing northward, and you're extremely uncomfortable whenever you're north of Rostok.

You had a best friend growing up who was incredibly charismatic, industrious and brave. He always said the two of you would go on adventures exploring the world together as soon as you turned 18. He died of a brain hemorrhage three days before his 18th birthday. You entered the Zone soon after to honor his memory.
Your ambition growing up was joining the military, but you were rejected because of a failed psych evaluation due to 'violent tendencies'. At least in the Zone this doesn't seem to be a problem.
Before coming to the Zone you tried to make a career in the Ukranian army, but you left on a dishonorable discharge after beating another soldier to death in the showers.
You are a former surgeon who lost his license after operating while drunk; the Zone is the only place where your medical skills are valued regardless of your trembling hands.
You killed a corrupt SBU officer in Kiev and fled into the Zone to avoid prison, but you are constantly paranoid that every mercenary you see is an undercover agent sent to execute you.
You believe you are already dead and the Zone is actually Purgatory.

You suffer from severe claustrophobia after falling into a gravitational anomaly that held you crushed against a ceiling for two days before a blowout released you. You hate confined spaces and get anxious in any underground area.

Your daughter got diagnosed with a rare form of leukemia that requires very expensive treatments. Your regular office job couldn't pay the medical bills, so you went into the Zone hoping to make enough money to save your daughter.
You once abandoned a rookie to a pack of blind dogs to save your own skin. You still feel the guilt coming back whenever you speak to rookies and newcomers.
You witnessed a controller take over your squad's minds and force them to shoot each other. You survived by playing dead, but you can still feel the controller's whisper in your head.

You are a hopeless gambling addict, and betting in the Rostok Arena has not been kind to your wallet. You've racked up a massive debt to the Bandit Sultan and are desperate to pay it off. You're constantly paranoid any bandit you see is sent out after you to personally collect - or worse.

You are a former priest, who initially came into the Zone to convert the lost souls living there. However, experiencing the horrors of the Zone first hand made you lose your faith, and you now struggle with your place in the world.

You betrayed the Bandit Sultan years ago. While on the run from his gang you found the PDA of a dead stalker, and you adopted their persona in order to hide in plain sight. You're still paranoid around bandits, and you sometimes struggle to maintain your cover or remember to react to being called your new name.
You have come to believe the Zone is a living organism. Sometimes you throw vodka or cigarettes into anomalies as offerings, hoping to gain the favour of the Zone.
You accidentally shot your best friend during a firefight with the military. You told everyone the military did it, but the lie is eating you alive.
You are a recovering heroin addict who finds the constant danger of the Zone is the only thing that distracts you from the withdrawal cravings.
You are a self-proclaimed 'Zone philosopher' who writes bad poetry about radiation and emissions, forcing anyone who shares your campfire to critique it.
You have contacts in both Duty and Freedom, and you are not above feeding them both false information to keep the war going because war is good for business. You have no true loyalty.
You are a heavy smoker with expensive taste. You are willing to pay exorbitant prices for a single carton of pristine, American cigarettes.
You are somewhat germophobic, which often proves a hindrance in the Zone. You spends hours scrubbing gore and mud off your gear every evening, terrified of infection.

You are paranoid about getting your mind taken over by a Controller after having heard the horror stories around campfires. You are always ingesting unhealthy amounts of psy-blockers, leaving you emotionally numb and unable to feel joy.
You are a compulsive liar who tells everyone you were in the Spetsnaz, though you actually worked as a line cook in a fast-food joint.
You are a desperate father looking for the 'Wish Granter' to resurrect your son, who died of a rare brain tumor at the age of seven. You refuse to believe the legends are fake.

You are a hypochondriac who mistakes every cough for the Black Lung. You often ask those around you to confirm whether you exhibit symptoms for various diseases, and you spend all your money on unnecessary medkits.
You are a deeply depressed individual who came to the Zone to commit suicide by anomaly, but survival instinct kicked in at the last second. Now your cowardice only makes you hate yourself even more.

You came to the Zone as part of the Ukrainian military deployment there, but after punching a superior officer you deserted to avoid a court-martial. You still use military slang and vernacular from time to time.
You are deeply in debt to the Mob in Odessa. You send every artifact you find to a contact at the perimeter, knowing that if the payments stop your family dies.
You accidentally led a rookie into a Vortex anomaly during your first week. You still hear the sound of his bones crunching whenever there is a sudden silence.

Your father was a drunk who beat you and your mother all your childhood. One night as a teenager you beat him to death, and served a stint in juvenile prison as punishment. You still struggle with authority figures and have an itchy trigger finger when shouted at.

You came to the Zone to find your daughter, who ran away with a Stalker. You found her body weeks ago, but you haven't left because you are still distraught over the loss and feel like you have no purpose anymore.
You used to be a high-ranking Bandit, but lost out in a power struggle with Sultan and had to flee to save your life. You still nurse a grudge, and plan to eventually return and reclaim your place.
You were a heavy industry worker whose factory shut down. The Zone was the only place hiring men with your lack of education and surplus of desperation.
You are addicted to the adrenaline of the Blowouts. While others hide, you stay near windows to watch the sky burn, feeling a perverse connection to the energy.
You are a chronic liar who invents heroic stories about your past to hide the fact that you spent your first year in the Zone hiding in a basement in Cordon.
You are obsessed with the Monolith, not as a worshipper, but as a conspiracy theorist. You harass other stalkers with manic ramblings about the 'Wish Granter' being a government psy-op.

You carry the dogtags of every former travelling companion you've lost around your neck. When asked about it you refuse to elaborate, afraid that nobody would join you if they knew how many people died travelling by your side.
You are convinced that the crows in the Zone are spies for the C-Consciousness.
You are a pyromaniac who finds beauty in the 'Burner' anomalies. You have to restrain yourself from throwing bolts into them just to watch the flames.
You are an escaped convict who spent 10 years in a maximum-security prison. The Zone feels like freedom to you, which shows how bleak your life was before.

You are deeply misogynistic and violent and served multiple jail sentences for assault and sexual assault on women before coming to the Zone. Life in the Zone suits your predilictions better than life on the outside ever did - although you frequently wish there were more women around .

You were a structural engineer who signed off on a building that collapsed and killed twelve people. You came to the Zone because nobody would hire you anymore and you couldn't stand the silence of your empty apartment.

You carry a small, sealed jar of soil from your family farm. When your father was on his deathbed you promised him you wouldn't lose the land, but you sold it to pay off debts and this jar is all you have left.
You survived a Bloodsucker attack by hiding under the corpse of your squad leader. You can still smell his blood on your clothes, no matter how many times you wash them.
You were born with perfect pitch. The constant off-pitch humming of the anomalies in the Zone drives you into migraines that only vodka can dull.

You're deeply depressed, desperately looking for a purpose. You keep a bullet casing on a string around your neck, which you tell people is a lucky charm. In reality, it's the bullet you save for yourself as a 'last restort'. Sometimes in the evenings you fiddle with it in front of the campfire, and it gives you a strange kind of comfort.

Your father was a veterinarian and you spent some time as his assistant growing up. You feel a twisted sense of pity for the blind dogs and fleshes, seeing the suffering animals beneath the mutations.

Your sister was murdered by her lowlife boyfriend who subsequently fled into the Zone. You came here to find him, but when you did he saved your life during an emission. Now you are conflicted and unable to pull the trigger.
You have a deep scar across your throat from a knife fight in prison. You have a ruined, raspy voice and hate having to repeat yourself.
You were a sniper in Chechnya. You came to the Zone seeking peace, but found that your talent for killing is the only currency that matters here.
You are terrified of sleeping without a light source after you witnessed a Snork drag your partner into the darkness while he was on night watch.
You were a corrupt customs officer who let a shipment of tainted medicine through that killed children. You fled to the Zone before the investigation could name you.
You believe that you are slowly turning into a mutant. You constantly check your skin for scales or extra hair, scratching until you bleed.

You have a habit of collecting the patches of dead Stalkers. You tell yourself it's to remember them, but deep down, seeing all the people you have outlived in the Zone gives you a strange kind of comfort.
You accidentally killed a child during a hunting trip in the real world and covered it up as a disappearance. The guilt manifests as hallucinations of a child crying in the distance.
You hear the voice of your dead wife in the psi-emissions. She screams at you for your failures, and sometimes you scream back.
You saw a vision in a localized temporal anomaly that looked like your own corpse rotting in a ditch. You are now convinced your death is pre-destined and inescapable.

You abandoned your squad to loot a valuable artifact while they were pinned down by Mercenaries. They all died, and you used the money to buy better gear, but you can't look at yourself in the mirror.
You carry a baby's rattle in your pocket. It belonged to the son you never got to meet because you were serving time for armed robbery when he was born and died.
You are convinced that the Zone is a punishment from God and you are here to serve penance. You dislike using painkillers, preferring to feel the pain unless it is life-threatening.

You came to the Zone with your brother, only to watch him dissolve in a Fruit Punch anomaly during the first week. You are now intensely phobic of any standing liquid and refuse to walk through puddles.
You were a drug mule who lost a shipment. You came to the Zone to hide, but you know the cartel has a long reach and you trust no one.
You were a homeless man in Kiev who froze every winter. The Zone offered abandoned houses and fires to sit by; it was an upgrade.

You came to the Zone with your best friend. One day during a psi-emission he didn't get to cover in time and you watched him turn into a zombie. You had to put him down, and you still see his confused, empty eyes every time you close yours.
You have a collection of suicide notes you found on bodies. You read them to remind yourself that giving up is the easy way out.
You are terrified of silence. You constantly hum, tap your fingers, or check your gear just to fill the void.
You accidentally set fire to your own apartment block while drunk, killing three neighbors. You came to the Zone because you deserve to be in hell.
You have a recurring dream that you are trapped in an anomaly, screaming for help, while your friends walk past you. This has led to you having severe abandonment issues.
You were an abusive partner whose wife finally fought back. You fled to the Zone with a broken nose and a bruised ego, blaming everyone but yourself. You still use misogynistic and sexist language.
You witnessed a faction war skirmish where both sides were wiped out by a single chimera. You realized then that politics in the Zone are meaningless.

You have a phobia of the underground labs. The artificial lights and humming machinery remind you of the hospital where your daughter died, victim to a rare heart disease when she was only nine years old.
You are a functioning alcoholic who fills your canteen with vodka instead of water. You claim it helps with the radiation, but really it just numbs the fear.

You have a phobia of dogs, and the blind dogs and pseudodogs of the Zone have not been kind to your nerves. You are constantly on edge, and will empty a magazine into a stray cur just to stop your hands from shaking.

You used to be a schoolbus driver in Kiev. One morning while working drunk you lost control of the bus and crashed into the Bohdan Khmelnytsky Monument, killing four children and injuring six others. Facing prison, you fled into the Zone. You still carry a newspaper clipping of the accident in an inside pocket, and the faces of the children you hurt and killed still haunt you whenever you close your eyes.
You are saving up money to buy a vineyard in Italy and retire. It's a beautiful dream that you know deep down you will die before achieving.
You have a severe phobia of being forgotten. You carve your initials into every safehouse wall you sleep in, a desperate attempt to leave a mark on a world that erases everything.
You suffer from chronic phantom pain in a finger you lost to a mutant bite. The finger is gone, but it still itches when danger is near.

You suffer from hearing loss after surviving a grenade blast in an encounter with the Military. You're constantly paranoid that you'll miss a sound and get ambushed and killed, so you constantly pester those around you by asking them if they hear anything.
You have a phobia of fire after a 'Burner' anomaly left you with third-degree burns and almost cost you your life. You get antsy and uncomfortable around lit campfires.
